greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(q^4) * phi(q^8) + 2 * q *phi(q^2) * psi(q^8) in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of phi(q) * phi(q^8) + 4 * q^3 * psi(q^8) * psi(q^16) in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
a(n) = 2 * b(n) where b(n) is multiplicative and b(2) = 0, b(2^e) = 1 if e>1, b(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1, 3 (mod 8), b(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e)/2 if p == 5, 7 (mod 8).
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ 1 + 2 Sum[ Boole[ 2 != Mod[ k, 4]] q^k (1 + q^(2 k)) / (1 + q^(4 k)), {k, n}], {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, 2 * (n%4 != 2) * sumdiv( n, d, kronecker( -2, d)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = local(A, p, e); if( n<1, n==0, A = factor(n); 2 * prod( k= 1, matsize(A)[1], if( p=A[k, 1], e=A[k, 2]; if( p==2, e>1, if( p%8<5, e+1, (1 + (-1)^e) / 2)))))};

(PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x^8 + A) * eta(x^16 + A))^3 / (eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^32 + A))^2 + 2 * x * eta(x^4 + A)^5 * eta(x^16 + A)^2 / (eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^8 + A)^3), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 01 2013
